title.narrative: ACCESS TO VIOLENCE PREVENTION, REPORTING AND RESPONSE MECHANISMS

description.narrative: By 2022, children and caregivers have access to violence prevention, reporting and response mechanisms, which contributes to Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable children in Ukraine benefit from more-child-friendly and family-oriented social welfare and justice systems.

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Integrated Office 1 Klovskiy Uzviz 01021 Kiev

related-activity.ref: 4410/A0/05/882 CHILD-FRIENDLY AND FAMILY-ORIENTED SOCIAL WELFARE AND JUSTICE SYSTEMS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, children and caregivers have access to violence prevention, reporting and response mechanisms

description.narrative: The issue of Violence Against Children continued to be a priority for UNICEF and national partners in 2021. UNICEF’s advocacy resulted in prioritization of specialized services for child-victims and witnesses of violence such as application of the Barnahus model. The Barnahus model brings in a new strategic approach to child-friendly judicial and protection procedures and is of interest for national and sub-national authorities. In addition, UNICEF expanded its’ positive parenting programs aiming to prevent violence against children, continued GBV services in the East and contributed to initiatives in the area of on-line protection.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
